intro: Cacalia intermedia, commonly known as the common bluebell, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its blue to violet flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with slender stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are arranged in clusters and are often visited by bees and other pollinators. Cacalia intermedia is often found in grasslands, woodlands, and along roadsides, thriving in well-drained soils.
